page_content:
Model - Add Calculation Fields

Version:MissionOS_2.0

In Admin > Data Object Configuration > Object Definition, under the Model tab, you can set up an instrument model subtype incorporating data fields, calibration fields, calculation fields, and calculated calibration fields. 

To access this feature, click open the Data Manager.

Go to Admin > Data Object Configuration > Object Definition > Model.

Select the required Class Type, Class, Type and Subtype.

In this manual, you can follow instructions as how to add calculation fields to the created Subtype.

There is no restriction on the number of calculation fields you can add to a subtype.

To add a calculation field, follow the steps below:

  1. Click the Add Fields.

 

 

 

  1. Select Field Type as Calculation.
  2. System Field Name, for instance “calculation3”, is auto-generated.
  3. Enter User Field Name.

Note:
User Field names must conform to the following rules:

  1. The user field names must be in lower case.
  2. The allowable special character is 'underscore', and cannot contain spaces.

 

  1. Enter User Field Label – this determines how the field will be shown in graphs, tables and so on.
  2. Enter Description if any.
  3. Enter the Function for calculation. (User can create a formula using Data fields and Calibration fields. A set of operands are also available for calculations.)
  4. Select Measure.
  5. Select Units.
  6. Select Display Precision.
  7. Select the Calculation Order – this determines the order in which the system processes the calculations.
  8. Click Test to test calculation function.
  9. Click Save to save the information fields.
  10. To confirm the successful creation of the calculation field, click Okay.
    The newly created calculation field gets listed in the table.

 

To watch the Web User Manual video on How To: Add Calculation Fields in MissionOS, simply click on the thumbnail or link below:
